Putting on more pressure
Smart move. Preparing to separate my bishop and queen, relieving all the stress on the F pawn. I did not realize the bad position my queen was in.
I was almost tempted into Qb4. But it didn't take me too long to realize that would be horrible trap when they push pawn a5.

My coach used to joke all the time about how I would never castle in a game. Well this proves castling is a powerful move.

And he does it
A very daring plan forms in my head at this point. I study the board for maybe ten minutes and then I make the move I already knew I was going to do.

My opponent is starting to become confused though it doesn't take him long to make his move

Brilliant! If he takes the pawn Re1 and his queen gets pinned in front of his king. This would have ended the game. I had to leave the room at this point. My whole body was shaking and I was starting to feel feverish. I paced the hall and took many sips of water as I waited for my opponents move.

Brilliant! If he takes the pawn Re1 and his queen gets pinned in front of his king. This would have ended the game. I had to leave the room at this point. My whole body was shaking and I was starting to feel feverish. I paced the hall and took many sips of water as I waited for my opponents move.
He didn't fall for it. The move confused him greatly but after maybe ten minutes of hard thinking he saw the danger.
Getting my points back....
I thought quite a while to decide what to do. I just knew that I needed to act quickly if I wanted to prevent a king-side castle.
